headline: PepsiCo Boosts Stake in Celsius With $585 Million Deal
summary: John Fieldly, Celsius CEO, says energy drinks are the fastest-growing category in the market and the deal with Pepsi's Rockstar maximizes the value of Celsius' portfolio. He tells Scarlet Fu and Bailey Lipschultz on "The Close" the company is also focusing on female consumers with a lifestyle brand for today's health-minded customer.

summary: Shares of energy drink company Celsius (NASDAQ:CELH) jumped 5.1% in the morning session after the company announced a strengthened long-term strategic partnership with beverage giant PepsiCo, which is boosting its stake in the company by $585 million.

headline: Celsius Holdings (CELH) Expands Partnership With PepsiCo; Acquires Rockstar Energy For US$585M
summary: Celsius Holdings (CELH) recently enhanced its strategic position through a transformative partnership with PepsiCo, which included a $585 million equity investment and expanded distribution rights for key energy drink brands. This collaboration, strengthening Celsius's influence over its product portfolio, contributed to a 58% rise in its stock price over the last quarter. While major indexes like the S&P 500 and Dow saw gains, Celsius's substantial market movements were further supported by...

headline: Chip stocks, Caterpillar, PepsiCo & Celsius: Trending Tickers

headline: Celsius Becomes PepsiCo's US Energy Drink Captain In Major Portfolio Deal
summary: On Friday, Celsius Holdings, Inc. (NASDAQ:CELH) surged in premarket trading after unveiling a sweeping agreement with beverage giant PepsiCo Inc. (NASDAQ:PEP). The company said that the deal reshapes the energy drink landscape in North America, giving Celsius control of additional brands and extending PepsiCo’s distribution role. The new arrangement strengthens the long-standing partnership between the two companies, combining Celsius’ fast-rising labels with PepsiCo’s vast retail network. Also

headline: PepsiCo sharpens energy drink focus with bigger Celsius stake
summary: Shares of Celsius, which owns a namesake energy drink and other hydration brands, were up nearly 5% in early trading on Friday.  PepsiCo has bought 5% in Celsius' preferred stock, bringing its stake to about 11% after conversion.  The company had paid $550 million for an 8.5% stake in Celsius in 2022.
